title: Quiz 2: Communication Counseling
description: NCK 2025 Predictions for Communication Counseling (Set 5). Contains 50 questions.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes therapeutic communication in nursing?

options.text: ) A purposeful interaction to promote patient well-being
) Sharing gossip about patients with colleagues
) Using medical jargon when talking to patients

questions.explanation: Therapeutic communication is a purposeful interaction aimed at improving the patient’s emotional and physical well-being, promoting trust, and fostering understanding.

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of SBAR (Situation, Background, Assessment, Recommendation) in nursing communication?

options.text: ) To document patient care for legal reasons
) To facilitate clear and concise information transfer
) To provide informal updates to patients’ families

questions.explanation: SBAR is a standardized communication tool that helps nurses and healthcare providers share critical information clearly and concisely, especially during handoffs or emergencies.

questions.question: Which form of communication is most effective for ensuring accurate exchange of complex clinical data?
questions.explanation: Written documentation provides a permanent, detailed record of complex clinical data, reducing misinterpretation and supporting continuity of care.

questions.question: Which barrier commonly affects effective communication between nurses and patients?
questions.explanation: Cultural differences can create misunderstandings or discomfort, affecting communication effectiveness if not acknowledged and managed properly.

questions.question: In a nursing team, which type of communication is essential to avoid errors in patient care?
questions.explanation: Assertive communication promotes clear, respectful exchange of ideas and concerns, reducing errors and enhancing teamwork.

questions.question: What is the main purpose of networking among healthcare professionals?

options.text: ) To improve patient care through collaboration and resource sharing

questions.explanation: Professional networking in healthcare facilitates sharing knowledge, resources, and support, leading to improved patient outcomes.

questions.question: When documenting patient care, which of the following is a key principle?
questions.explanation: Documenting care chronologically ensures clarity and helps trace the patient’s progress over time accurately.

questions.question: What does non-verbal communication in nursing primarily involve?
questions.explanation: Non-verbal communication includes body posture, gestures, facial expressions, and eye contact, which can convey emotions and attitudes.

questions.question: Which of these is the best example of active listening in nursing?

options.text: ) Nodding and summarizing the patient’s concerns
) Checking the time while the patient talks

questions.explanation: Active listening involves showing understanding through nodding, clarifying, and summarizing to confirm the patient’s message.

questions.question: Which communication method is considered most secure for sharing sensitive patient information?
questions.explanation: Encrypted email systems protect patient information confidentiality in compliance with privacy laws like HIPAA.

questions.question: What is the role of a nurse leader in facilitating communication within the team?

options.text: ) Encouraging open dialogue and resolving misunderstandings
) Limiting communication to formal meetings only

questions.explanation: Nurse leaders promote open communication, facilitate collaboration, and address conflicts to ensure effective team functioning.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes a healthcare network?

options.text: ) A group of patients sharing similar diseases
) A system of interconnected healthcare providers and services
) An informal social club for nurses

questions.explanation: A healthcare network links various providers and services to coordinate patient care efficiently across settings.

questions.question: When communicating with a patient who has hearing impairment, the nurse should:

options.text: ) Use written materials and clear visual cues

questions.explanation: Written materials and clear visual cues help overcome hearing barriers, ensuring understanding.

questions.question: What is a key advantage of electronic health records (EHR) in nursing communication?

options.text: ) They eliminate the need for verbal communication
) They allow instant access and updating of patient information
) They are less secure than paper records
) They limit data sharing among providers

questions.explanation: EHRs improve communication by providing real-time access to accurate, up-to-date patient data across healthcare teams.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a closed-ended question in nursing assessment?

options.text: ) “Do you have any pain right now?”

questions.explanation: Closed-ended questions typically elicit a yes/no or brief factual response, helpful for quick assessments.

questions.question: What is the most effective way for nurses to handle a communication breakdown with a colleague?

options.text: ) Discussing the issue openly and seeking resolution
) Reporting immediately to management without discussion
) Ignoring the problem hoping it resolves

questions.explanation: Open discussion helps identify misunderstandings and promotes collaborative problem-solving.

questions.question: Which type of communication is primarily involved when a nurse educates a patient about medication side effects?
questions.explanation: Therapeutic communication supports patient understanding, adherence, and health outcomes through clear education.

questions.question: What should a nurse do to ensure confidentiality during patient communication?

options.text: ) Discuss patient information in the nurse’s lounge
) Speak quietly in private settings and avoid sharing information unnecessarily
) Share patient details on social media for awareness

questions.explanation: Confidentiality is maintained by sharing information only when necessary and in private environments.

questions.question: Which of the following best represents a collaborative network in healthcare?

options.text: ) Healthcare professionals coordinating care through shared plans and meetings
) Managers giving orders without consulting staff

questions.explanation: Collaborative networks involve professionals working together to plan and deliver comprehensive patient care.

questions.question: What is a common disadvantage of using email for nurse-to-nurse communication?

options.text: ) It may delay urgent communication due to response times
) It is secure for all types of information

questions.explanation: Email may not be suitable for urgent messages due to potential delays in reading or responding.

questions.question: When communicating with a non-English speaking patient, the nurse should:

options.text: ) Use a professional interpreter or translation service

questions.explanation: Using professional interpreters ensures accurate and respectful communication, reducing misunderstandings.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a function of nursing documentation?

options.text: ) Communicating patient status to the healthcare team
) Personal notes for the nurse’s memory only

questions.explanation: Documentation is professional and objective, not personal notes; it serves communication, legal, and financial purposes.

questions.question: What communication style involves expressing needs and feelings while respecting others?
questions.explanation: Assertive communication balances self-expression with respect for others, leading to effective interactions.

questions.question: Which wireless technology is commonly used in hospitals to enable nurse call systems?
questions.explanation: Infrared technology is often used for nurse call systems due to its line-of-sight communication and reliability indoors.

questions.question: Which of the following best defines a healthcare intranet?

options.text: ) The public internet accessed by nurses
) A private, secure network used within a healthcare organization
) A social media platform for patients
) A wireless network accessible to the public

questions.explanation: A healthcare intranet is a secure internal network facilitating communication and access to information within the organization.

questions.question: Which communication style is most effective when giving feedback to a colleague?
questions.explanation: Assertive communication respects both the speaker’s and listener’s feelings and opinions, promoting clarity and respect, which is vital for effective feedback in nursing.

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of a nurse using SBAR communication?
questions.explanation: SBAR (Situation, Background, Assessment, Recommendation) is a standardized framework designed to facilitate clear, concise, and structured communication among healthcare professionals, ensuring patient safety and efficient care.

questions.question: Which of the following is a barrier to effective communication in nursing?
questions.explanation: Cultural differences can create misunderstandings due to varying beliefs, languages, or customs, posing a significant barrier to effective communication in nursing.

questions.question: What is the most appropriate method to maintain confidentiality during nurse-to-nurse communication?

options.text: ) Discuss patient information loudly in the nurse’s station
) Share patient details on social media for advice
) Leave patient files open on the desk

questions.explanation: Maintaining confidentiality is crucial; using secure, authorized platforms like electronic health records ensures information is shared responsibly, protecting patient privacy.

questions.question: When communicating with a non-English speaking patient, what should a nurse do first?

options.text: ) Assume the patient understands basic English

questions.explanation: Using a professional interpreter ensures accurate communication, avoiding misunderstandings, and enhancing patient care quality.

questions.question: What role does nonverbal communication play in nursing?

options.text: ) It has no effect on patient care
) It complements and reinforces verbal messages
) It replaces the need for verbal communication

questions.explanation: Nonverbal cues such as facial expressions and gestures enhance the meaning of verbal communication, improving understanding and rapport with patients.

questions.question: In networking among healthcare professionals, what is the primary benefit?
questions.explanation: Networking promotes sharing knowledge, resources, and support among professionals, which enhances teamwork and patient care quality.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of active listening?

options.text: ) Nodding and summarizing what was said
) Looking at a phone while someone is speaking

questions.explanation: Active listening involves giving full attention, providing feedback such as nodding, and summarizing to confirm understanding, which improves communication effectiveness.

questions.question: Which communication channel is best for urgent information between nurses?
questions.explanation: Phone calls allow immediate, direct communication, making them suitable for urgent matters, while emails and reports may delay responses.

questions.question: When documenting patient care, which of the following is most important?
questions.explanation: Accurate and legible documentation ensures continuity of care, legal protection, and clear communication among healthcare providers.

questions.question: What is an effective way to manage conflict during team communication?

options.text: ) Listening to all perspectives and seeking compromise
) Ignoring the conflict hoping it resolves itself

questions.explanation: Effective conflict management requires understanding all sides and collaboratively finding a solution, which maintains team cohesion and patient safety.

questions.question: How can a nurse best support a patient who is anxious during communication?

options.text: ) Speaking rapidly to get information quickly
) Maintaining a calm and reassuring tone

questions.explanation: A calm tone helps reduce patient anxiety, builds trust, and facilitates clearer communication. Rapid speech and jargon may increase anxiety.

questions.question: Which of the following networking tools is commonly used for professional nursing communication?
questions.explanation: LinkedIn is designed for professional networking and is used by healthcare professionals to connect, share knowledge, and collaborate.

questions.question: What should a nurse do when receiving unclear instructions from a physician?
questions.explanation: Clarifying ensures patient safety and prevents errors by confirming understanding of instructions before proceeding.

questions.question: Which principle is essential when communicating bad news to patients?

options.text: ) Using technical terms to sound professional

questions.explanation: Delivering bad news with honesty and empathy supports patient dignity and emotional wellbeing, fostering trust.

questions.question: In nursing handoffs, which practice ensures effective communication?
questions.explanation: Standardized tools reduce errors by ensuring all critical patient information is consistently communicated during handoffs.

questions.question: What type of question encourages patients to express their feelings?
questions.explanation: Open-ended questions allow patients to elaborate on thoughts and feelings, enhancing patient-centered communication.

questions.question: Which method best supports interprofessional communication?
questions.explanation: Team meetings foster collaboration, shared decision-making, and comprehensive care planning.

questions.question: How should a nurse respond when a patient asks a question outside their scope?

options.text: ) Refer the question to the appropriate professional
) Tell the patient to look it up

questions.explanation: Referring ensures patients get accurate information while respecting professional boundaries.

questions.question: What is a key component of therapeutic communication?
questions.explanation: Confidentiality builds trust and safety, which are fundamental in therapeutic communication.

questions.question: When using email for professional communication, which practice is most appropriate?
questions.explanation: Professional emails should be clear and to the point to avoid misunderstandings and maintain professionalism.

questions.question: What is the best approach when a nurse disagrees with a physician’s order?

options.text: ) Discuss concerns respectfully with the physician

questions.explanation: Open, respectful communication supports patient safety and professional collaboration.

questions.question: Which factor most influences successful nurse-patient communication?
questions.explanation: A private, quiet environment reduces distractions and promotes open, honest communication.

questions.question: Which technique helps overcome communication barriers with a hearing-impaired patient?

options.text: ) Using written communication and sign language

questions.explanation: Adapting communication methods like writing or sign language ensures the patient understands and participates fully.

questions.question: What is the best way for a nurse to confirm understanding after giving instructions?
questions.explanation: Teach-back asks patients to repeat instructions in their own words, confirming comprehension and improving adherence.
